result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Patrick Ley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order for payment of attorney fees per statement submitted by Attorney Bennett on 5-31-16
Filed by Atty Mark Bennett
Filed by Atty Mark Bennett
Defendant, Jason Patrick Ley, appeared. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 02:45 pm.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Cases heard: 15CM247, 15CM565 & 14CM596, Defendant Jason Patrick Ley in court with attorney Mark H Bennett.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deferred Prosecution Agreement revoked in 14CM596. Court entered judgment in 14CM596. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to both counts in 15CM247. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence in both cases: 1 year probation, consecutive to present sentence (Extended Supervision). Continue with domestic abuse counseling as agent deems, submit DNA sample. In 15CM247 - $543 & $243 costs, payable to Clerk of Court, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. In 14CM596 - $543 costs, payable to Clerk of Court, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Jail credit, if any, to be determined by stipulation. 15CM565 dismissed.
